info.description:
This is the documentation of the SitaWare Headquarters REST API.

**Authentication and Authorization**

Service methods may require authentication and authorization of the calling user.
The requirements are described in the description of each service method.

The authentication method that should be used is determined by the security option chosen at installation time.
E.g. if SitaWare Headquarters is installed with the file based security option then BASIC authentication is used.
This means the HTTP header "Authorization" should be set with a proper base64 encoded user name and password as
defined in the HTTP specification.
Other authentication methods have different requirements.

Authorization to call a service method is handled through privileges that are mapped to user roles through the PermissionNameMapping.xml file.
The mentioned privileges are the minimum privileges a caller need to have in order to be authorized to call the method.
Depending on the current state of the data, additional privileges may be required. E.g. the privileges needed to change the plan state
is dependant on the current state of the plan.

Note, that objects that supports Access Control Lists (ACL) may impose additional restrictions to the operations that can
performed.

**Status Codes**

The documentation sections of the various service operations do not contain individual information on possible status codes.
Instead the general rule is that a successful invocation returns a status code in the 200 series, whereas an unsuccessful
invocation returns either a status code in the 400 series or status code 500.

**Symbol Service**

The symbol data type represents a symbol. All types of symbols are represented by this type. It has a number of common
  properties shared by all symbol types, and an associated object that holds the specific properties for a particular symbol type.
The type of the associated object is determined by the type property. The associated object in turn has a common set of properties
in addition to the specific properties for the type. The figure below shows the relation.

![alt text](./images/symbolservice.jpg "LayerCatalogue service data types")

**Unit Service**

The Unit Service supports operations on units in the organisation structure. It is possible to set own unit
and modify units in the organisation structure as well as querying information about units and their subordinates.

An unit is identified uniquely by the Fully Qualified Name (FQN) and is based on the path the
unit has in the associated ORBAT.

**Holding Service**

The holdings service allows users to configure and distribute Holdings types and templates for keeping track
on inventory for an organisation. Holdings are based on a concept of distributing templates to subordinates who
then reports on the requested types. This relation of superior – subordinate is recurring whenever a template is
distributed to the next link -in the chain of command.

The endpoint names are split up in three categories: types, shared and local.
* 'types' endpoints support operations on holding types: create, delete, import, export and retrieving holding type information.
* 'shared' endpoints deal with operations for sharing holding reports holding types used in the template
* 'local' endpoints support operations regarding retrieving and editing holdings for local use and not sharing new information.

put.summary: Adds or removes nominal holding types for organisation in specified ORBAT.
put.description: Requires authentication and the privilege 'EditOrbat'.

post.summary: Sends holding report to superior unit.

delete.summary: Deletes specified holding type. If holding type in use, then exception HoldingTypeInUseException will be thrown.

get.summary: Gets holding report for given unit.
Gets all holding types

post.summary:
Creates a new holding type. The specified category, holdingClass, holdingSubClass, holdingSubSubClass and unitOfMeasure have validation rules.
                          The rules can be retrieved by calling "/rest/v1/holding/types/legalValues" endpoint.
                          In addition, holding types are unique on the combination of
                          name, category, holdingClass, holdingSubClass, holdingSubSubClass and unitOfMeasure.
post.description: Requires authentication and the privilege 'EditHoldingTypes'.

post.summary: Imports holdings types in the SHF XML format.
post.description: Requires authentication.

get.summary: Exports holdings types in the SHF XML format.

put.summary: List of holding type ids specifying the types that are shown in the holding overview.
put.description: Requires authentication and the privilege 'EditHoldingReport'.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: List of holding types that included into template

post.summary: Sets the actual holdings for a unit specified by Fully Qualified Name. If the holding types are marked as ‘in template’ the quantity will be included when sending the holding report if the FQN specified ‘own unit’, otherwise the holding types will be part of the template sent to the subordinate specified by the FQN.
post.description: Requires authentication and the privilege 'EditHoldingReport'.

post.summary: Creates an actual holding item if it does not exist, otherwise update. If marked as ‘in template’ the quantity will be included when sending the holding report if the FQN specified ‘own unit’, otherwise the holding type will be part of the template sent to the subordinate specified by FQN.
post.description: Requires authentication and the privilege 'EditHoldingReport'.

post.summary: Sends all templates to subordinate units.
post.description: Requires authentication and the privilege 'EditHoldingReport'.

post.description: payload shall contain the group definition. Requires authentication and the privilege 'track-server-user'.

get.summary: Gets a filter layer
get.description: The list of source layers contained in the filter layer will be filtered according to the callers Access Control List (ACL) permissions. Also note, that filter layers are also called smart layers. Requires authentication and the privilege 'track-server-user'.

put.summary: Updates a filter layer
put.description: The payload shall contain the definition of the filter layer that will be used to update the current filter layer. Also note, that filter layers are also called smart layers. Requires authentication and the privilege 'track-server-user'.

delete.description: Note, that filter layers are also called smart layers. Requires authentication and the privilege 'track-server-user'.

get.summary: Returns known usage of the layer. Like number of source layers it has (COP Management Contracts) and if it used in other contracts (AIS, NFFI, NVG, OTG out and ingoing etc).

post.summary: Imports a track layer
post.description: Requires authentication and the privilege 'track-server-user'.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The Track Layer Format (TLF/PTLF) XML file content

put.summary: Updates a layer
put.description: The payload shall contain the definition of the layer that will be used to update the current definition of the layer. Requires authentication and the privilege 'track-server-user'.

put.summary: Updates a group
put.description: The payload shall contain the definition of the group that will be used to update the current definition of the group. Requires authentication and the privilege 'track-server-user'.

post.summary: Copies a layer including its symbols to a C2 group
post.description: A C2 group will always have one of the 5 C2 layer types (e.g. "Globally Significant" or "Friend and Neutral (Organisational)"). Any layer copied to a C2 group will become a C2 layer with that group type. E.g. if a plan layer is copied to a C2 group of type "Globally Significant", then the copy will become a "Globally Significant" layer instead of being a plan layer. Any C2 layer or plan layer can be copied to any C2 group (if permissions allows it) and will get the C2 type of the target group. However, layers cannot be copied to plan groups. Requires authentication and the privilege 'track-server-user'.

post.summary: Imports layer from XML format
post.description: The layer XML data must adhere to the SitaWare Layer Format (SLF) XML file specification. See the XML schema that is shipped as part of the SDK. Requires authentication and the privilege 'track-server-user'.

post.summary: Exports a list of identified layers to XML
post.description: The layer XML data must adhere to the SitaWare Layer Format (SLF) XML file specification. See the XML schema that is shipped as part of the SDK. Requires authentication and the privilege 'track-server-user'.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: A list of layer IDs to export

put.summary: Imports layers from an XML file
put.description: The layer XML data must adhere to the SitaWare Layer Format (SLF) XML file specification. See the XML schema that is shipped as part of the SDK. Requires authentication and the privilege 'track-server-user'.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The contents of the XML file

post.summary: Imports a C2 layer
post.description: Requires authentication and the privilege 'track-server-user'.

get.summary: Gets a catalogue of all layers and groups in the system
get.description:
Layers and groups are represented in the API with the GroupItemInfo model; in practice, this will be either a group (GroupInfo) or a layer (WorkspaceInfo).This can be seen in the this illustration:

Catalogue items are also filtered according to Access Control Lists of the individual group and layers in the layer catalogue. This means that a caller may only get a partial view of the catalogue.
Due to issues with our API documentation tool, some models are presented here, instead of in the "Model" option below.
WorkspaceInfo {
id (string, optional),
index (integer, optional),
presentationName (string, optional),
presentationPath (string, optional),
rolesWithReadAccess (Array[string], optional)
string
Unique Items:true
,
rolesWithWriteAccess (Array[string], optional)
string
Unique Items:true
,
rolesWithOwnerAccess (Array[string], optional)
string
Unique Items:true
,
organisationOwnerId (string, optional),
hasOwnerAccess (boolean, optional)
boolean
Default:false
,
isOwnRepOrg (boolean, optional)
boolean
Default:false
,
parent (string, optional),
category (string, optional),
fullyQualifiedName (string, optional),
restrictedByUser (string, optional),
layerType (string, optional):

If the 'GroupItemInfo' contains property 'layerType' it is a 'WorkspaceInfo'

,
securityClassification (string, optional),
securityClassificationPrefix (string, optional),
securityClassificationPostfix (string, optional),
hasWriteAccess (boolean, optional)
boolean
Default:false
,
orgName (string, optional),
layerAnnotation (WorkspaceAnnotation, optional),
sourceLayers (Array[FilterLayerSourceLayerInfo], optional):

This property is only present for 'Smart Layer / Filter Layers'. These are the net source layers, i.e. a recursive resolved layer list with no filter layers

object
Unique Items:true
,
alarmEnabled (boolean, optional)
boolean
Default:false
,
trackDecorationDescriptionInfo (TrackDecorationDescriptionInfo, optional),
situationOverlayGroupItem (string, optional),
hasReadAccess (boolean, optional)
boolean
Default:false
}
WorkspaceAnnotation {
exerciseOrOperationInfo (string, optional),
msgId (string, optional),
msgIdOriginator (string, optional),
msgIdSerialNumber (string, optional),
msgIdAmplification (string, optional),
msgIdMonth (string, optional),
sourceIdentifier (string, optional),
startTime (string, optional),
stopTime (string, optional),
startTimeMils (string, optional),
stopTimeMils (string, optional),
geoDaticDatum (string, optional),
textIndicator (string, optional),
freeText (string, optional),
status (string, optional),
classification (string, optional),
url (string, optional),
shortDescription (string, optional),
longDescription (string, optional)
}
FilterLayerSourceLayerInfo {
layerType (string, optional),
category (string, optional),
id (string, optional),
name (string, optional),
hasWriteAccess (boolean, optional)
boolean
Default:false
,
hasReadAccess (boolean, optional)
boolean
Default:false
,
restrictedByUser (string, optional):

On private layers, this property indicates the user

,
rolesWithReadAccess (Array[string], optional)
string
Unique Items:true
,
rolesWithWriteAccess (Array[string], optional)
string
Unique Items:true
,
objectCount (integer, optional):

The number of objects on layer

,
filteredObjectCount (integer, optional):

The number of filtered objects on layer

,
exists (boolean, optional):

Wheather layer exists

boolean
Default:false
}
TrackDecorationDescriptionInfo {
styleExpression (string, optional),
size (string, optional):

Internal use only - will be deleted in a later version

}
. Requires authentication and the privilege 'track-server-user'.

get.summary: Gets a symbol from a given layer

put.summary: Updates a symbol
put.description:
The payload shall contain the definition of the symbol that will be used to update the current definition of the symbol.
The symbol data that is passed to the method must have the same type as the layer, e.g. if the layer is an NVG type 
layer, then the symbol data should represent an NVG symbol. Requires authentication and the privilege 'track-server-user'.

get.summary: Gets all symbols from a given layer

post.summary: Creates a symbol on a given layer
post.description: The symbol data that is passed to the method must have the same type as the layer, e.g. if the layer is an NVG type layer, then the symbol data should represent an NVG symbol. Requires authentication and the privilege 'track-server-user'.

post.description: Requires authentication and the privilege 'track-server-user'.

get.summary: Gets the configured enumerations
get.description: Some of the property values that can be set on a symbol are configurable on the server and this method returns these configurable values. Requires authentication and the privilege 'track-server-user'.

get.summary: Returns a boolean indicating whether the symbol with the specified id exists
Exports a route

subComponents.description:
An entry in the array is a pair of layerType and layerId e.g.:
 [[2,"default:61293a08-1b15-4a50-829c-a70400d62aa4"]]

legalValuesMap.description:
The tree has four levels representing category, class, subclass and subsubclass values respectively.
      Valid values for particular property(category, class, subclass) are children of that property.
      If property does not have any children, the holding type cannot be specified any further. For example
      the list of allowed subclasses for the class PersonalEquipment from the Consumable category can be
      retrieved as

      legalValuesMap['Consumable']['PersonalEquipment'].

extendedInformation.description: Custom information about the log entry

log.description: Message log output from the mapping

supportsSmartLayer.description: Indicates whether smart layers that have source layers of the specified layer type are supported by the paramter

name.description: The name of the mapping parameter

type.description: The type of data expected or output by the parameter

messageInformation.description: Only present if 'type' is 'StructuredMessage': Additional information about the structured message type

layerInformation.description: Only present if 'type' is 'Layer': Additional information about layer type

defaultValue.description: Default value being used if a value for this parameter is not specified when executing the mapping

nameFromStandard.description: The name of the basic structured message template, e.g. 'OWNSITREP'

identifier.description: The identifier of the schema containing the structured message template, e.g. 'urn:int:systematic:mtf:irisdemo:7.2' or '0599999999'

baseline.description: The baseline of the structured message template, e.g. 'irisdemo 7.2'

format.description: The format of the structured message.

lastModifiedBy.description: The user that last modified element

lastModified.description: The date of the last modification of the element

lastModifiedBy.description: The user that last modified element

lastModified.description: The date of the last modification of the element

version.description: The version of the task org

developmentState.description: The state of the task org

c2Id.description: The ID of the task org on the C2 Server

stateId.description: 0 = Draft, 1 = Approval in progress, 2 = Approved, 3 = Issued, 4 = Cancelled

lastModifiedBy.description: The user that last modified element

lastModified.description: The date of the last modification of the element

version.description: The version of the text document

developmentState.description: The state of the text document

lockedBy.description: The user that has the lock of the text document

size.description: The size of the text document

include.description: Wheather the text document is included in export

lastModifiedBy.description: The user that last modified element

lastModified.description: The date of the last modification of the element

version.description: The version of the synchronization matrix

developmentState.description: The state of the synchronization matrix

lastModifiedBy.description: The user that last modified element

lastModified.description: The date of the last modification of the element

lastModifiedBy.description: The user that last modified element

lastModified.description: The date of the last modification of the element

lastModifiedBy.description: The user that last modified element

lastModified.description: The date of the last modification of the element

restrictedByUser.description: On private layers, this property indicates the user

objectCount.description: The number of objects on layer

filteredObjectCount.description: The number of filtered objects on layer

groupType.description: If the 'GroupItemInfo' contains property 'groupType' it is a 'GroupInfo'

size.description: Internal use only - will be deleted in a later version

layerType.description: If the 'GroupItemInfo' contains property 'layerType' it is a 'WorkspaceInfo'

sourceLayers.description: This property is only present for 'Smart Layer / Filter Layers'. These are the netto source layers, i.e. a recursive resolved layer list with no filter layers

condition.description: Alarm condition. One of: [NEVER, ENTER, EXIT, MOVE]

restrictedByUser.description: Internal use only - will be deleted in later version

hasOwnerAccess.description: Whether current user has owner access to layer

hasReadAccess.description: Whether current user has read access to layer

hasWriteAccess.description: Whether current user has write access to layer

sourceLayers.description: The source layers of filter layer

date.description: Node date value in milliseconds since 01/01/1970

coordinates.description: Internal use only - will be deleted in later version

customAttributes.description: Key/value pairs of strings holding custom attributes, see 'Custom Attributes' section in Programmer's Guide

ownOrganizationTrackLayers.description: GroupItemInfo can either be a WorkspaceInfo or GroupInfo

restrictedByUser.description: Internal use only - will be deleted in later version

hasOwnerAccess.description: Whether current user has owner access to layer

hasReadAccess.description: Whether current user has read access to layer

hasWriteAccess.description: Whether current user has write access to layer

sourceLayers.description: The source layers of filter layer

customAttributes.description: Key/value pairs of strings holding custom attributes, see 'Custom Attributes' section in Programmer's Guide

reportTime.description: Reported time of the symbol in milliseconds since midnight, January 1, 1970 UTC

lastHeartbeat.description: 'Last Heartbeat time' of the symbol in milliseconds since midnight, January 1, 1970 UTC. Last Heartbeat time is only send if different from 'reportTime'. Last Heartbeat time is last time an external source send the track information

reliability.description: Allowed values: 0 (Unknown), 1 (Completely reliable), 2 (Usually reliable), 3 (Fairly reliable), 4 (Not usually reliable), 5 (Unreliable), 6 (Reliability cannot be judged)

id.description: The symbol ID. The format is "symbol-type:unique-id" where symbol-type is the number described above. A C2 symbol id could be 9:52b08acb-8bb1-4aa8. For AIS the format is "8:MMSI-number" where 8 is the symbol type number for AIS tracks

properties.description: Properties of the associated symbol object. BeaconObjectDto is the common class that the other object types inherits from.
